text: Stephen Chubin, also known as "Chube" (born February 8, 1944) is a retired American professional basketball player. ==College career== Born in New York City, Chubin played college basketball at the University of Rhode Island, with the Rhode Island Rams, where he became the school's all-time leading scorer.Anaheim Amigos page at RememberTheABA.com He was inducted into the University of Rhode Island Athletics Hall of Fame, in 1981.University of Rhode Island Athletic Hall of Fame. ==Professional career== Chubin was selected by the San Francisco Warriors, in the 3rd round (23rd pick overall), of the 1966 NBA draft. Chubin spent the 1966–67 season playing in the Italian League with Olimpia Milano, which placed second in the FIBA European Champions Cup (EuroLeague), behind Real Madrid. Chubin was the top scorer in the EuroLeague Finals, with 34 points.Anaheim Amigos page at RememberTheABA.com Chubin played for the Anaheim Amigos (1967–68), and by most accounts, was the most popular player with the team's fans.Anaheim Amigos page at RememberTheABA.com Chubin averaged 18.2 points per game during his first ABA season.Steve Chubin page at Basketball-Reference.com Also, during his first year with the Amigos, Chubin ranked second in the league in assists per game (4.7).Steve Chubin page at Basketball-Reference.com Chubin later played for the Los Angeles Stars, Minnesota Pipers, Indiana Pacers, and New York Nets (1968–69), the Pittsburgh Pipers, Pacers, and Kentucky Colonels (1969–70), in the American Basketball Association (ABA), in 226 games.Steve Chubin page at Basketball-Reference.com He also played in the Israeli League with Maccabi Tel Aviv. ==References== ==External links== *Sports-Reference Profile * *Safsal.co.il Profile Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:American expatriate basketball people in Italy Category:American men's basketball players Category:Anaheim Amigos players Category:Basketball players from New York (state) Category:Forest Hills High School (New York) alumni Category:Hamden Bics players Category:Indiana Pacers players Category:Israeli Basketball Premier League players Category:Jewish American sportspeople Category:Jewish men's basketball players Category:Kentucky Colonels players Category:Los Angeles Stars players Category:Maccabi Tel Aviv B.C. players Category:Minnesota Pipers players Category:New York Nets players Category:Olimpia Milano players Category:Pittsburgh Pipers players Category:Point guards Category:Rhode Island Rams men's basketball players Category:San Francisco Warriors draft picks Category:Small forwards Category:Shooting guards Category:Sportspeople from New York City
